title: With the increase of pointless casual swearing from official Riot sources...
body:
I decided to look up their new media manager.
https://media.giphy.com/media/1Qdp4trljSkY8/giphy.gif

What a dynamo! This guy is gonna take us into the 2020's easy!
http://i.imgur.com/F7ldG54.png[/img]

replies.body: "We're just like you! Promise! Le creme de le meme, am I right? Epic! Ha ha!"

"We got memes too!"
https://media.giphy.com/media/kKdgdeuO2M08M/giphy.gif
I can't tell if the joke is that the meme is ancient or that is supposed to be our response. Either way works +1.

I can verify that Rioters swear casually and pointlessly all the time. We aren't trying to do it just to make you think we're cool (small chance of that!). That's just how we talk.

We can try to tone it down if you think it detracts from our messages, but we wouldn't want to appear too rehearsed or polished either.

F bomb for casual and pointless emphasis.

#BetterNerfIrelia
If you put slash as in \\# on new lines it will display the hastag rather than formatting it to bigger text. Unless bigger text was your intention.

And even light research should get you something along these lines:

* A design stream with CertainlyT screaming "SCARBOROUGH YOUR MOTHERFUCKER" in-game
* Scarizard constantly posting memes on twitter
* Cactopus
* Rivington failing to conceal his F-bombs on live stream
* 10 seconds straight of Rivington swearing to introduce PTL
* Zileas trolling people on the old boards
* Smash Gizmo complaining about how his teams suck

There is *no way* a company with tons of 20-somethings that love video games & LoL aren't going to include profanities in their natural language. *They are people like us, they will act like us.*
Riot, stop fucking swearing. It's shameless, shitty, and abso-fucking-lutely unacceptable.

I say fuck perfect professionalism.

No reason you can't occasionally use it for emphasis.

There is no need to tone it back, the game is rated T by the ESRB (Online Interactions not being rated) so by all means be the Human you are do whatever you feel like, some people will have your back....... unless it's murder then you're on your own.
Rated T, but "passive-aggressiveness" is bannable.
yeh but if i tell someone he sucks it's bannable wewwwww more like pegi 3(or w/e the fkc it's called i never paid attention) 3 ever since season 4.

"They have 4 AP champs, Malphite. I don't think you should only get armor items." 

"Stfu muted. Don't tell me how to play you filthy casual. Reported"

" You have recently been reported for unsportsmanlike conduct.................. Etc. Etc."
yep exactly
So kled can use the word "bitching" among other more minor vulgarities with getting chat banned, but graves can't have his cigar? That's pretty messed up rito.
He vapes. Affirmed by riot themselves.

There's not any issue with the language, there's an issue with it sounding forced.  Like take the the last roundtable with the whole "we lied about solo queue" thing; I get that they want to convey that they did indeed "fuck up," and want to remind players they were sorry, but it's like they were trying too hard.  It gives the impression that they're doing it just to show us they care...but the continued emphasis that they fucked up (because let's be real here, Dynamic Queue has no place in League of Legends) makes it seem like they were told to be overly apologetic, and as a result, it doesn't feel genuine.  Especially when Scarra and Gbay criticized the system, and Socrates and Lobster immediately got defensive.

I have been a forum troll since i started this game. (for those unaware, a troll used to be just somebody who lurked in the shadows) Dropping the occasional F bomb is nothing compared to how a few select Rioters have acted in the past (note the public apologies a few have made on the old forum). All Riot employees are just average joes with feelings.

You have already vastly toned it down from what I've seen in the past.

People are people, you're the same as us.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qh2sWSVRrmo

So do I, like a sailor on occasion, I'm told. I tend to refrain from it in my more official communications.
I don't know if I'd say that it detracts from your messages, but "the whole thing smacks of effort, man". As soon as you _try_ to be a part of the gang, you are no longer a part of the gang and become '90's edgy' which is no fun for anyone.
http://i.imgur.com/h1x5Wfv.png[/img]
I'm gonna say you have every right to be yourself, and if other people think it's a publicity stunt, that's their problem.

Cussing has its place, but pointless use mostly serves to detract from professionalism and to disappoint some of your players.  The vulgar language has become more common lately and that is not a trend that I hope to see continue.  I don't care if you guys cuss in your comments, but why should I have to deal with vulgarities if I want to read the official publications that are important to my success in the game such as the patch notes?

My point is this:  if there is no need for the foul language in official publications, why is it there?

You guys are doing it way too much, to me it's not about the vulgarity it's just crude, noise, filler. Kled is one of the worst VO's in a long time and was the point where I fully noticed and felt sick of the trend. I just closed the video immediately when you bleeped out sh*t, literally bleeping out a word in a character's voice-over.

It is fine when it's deep in a blog or thread with passionate devs talking about their work, but not on headlines multiple times a week.

Just stop

You need to either grow up or stop being so sensitive and get offended by words. For Kled, that's his entire character HE'S FUCKING INSANE. His VO fits perfectly and it was put together well. They already explained the bleeped out word, it was a joke, it's funny to a lot of people that hear it. You act like Riot has done this a million times before. They aren't robots, how about you 'just stop' treating them like they are required to check your list of triggers. It's a bunch of guys and gals having fun/being casual with their job about a video game, it's not a position as professional as the president of the US.

While Riot has the right to be vulgar if they feel like it, it has suddenly become much more common.  Some of us like things to stay "proper" and "polite," which the vulgarities and cussing prevent.  We are not necessarily offended (they haven't gone that far with their language yet) but we are disappointed.

I thought you were all Robots from the future trying to drive us humans mad with your tank {{champion:157}} 's and {{champion:92}} buffs...Good, good, i am glad to know you are just regular humans... trying to drive other humans mad with your tank {{champion:157}}'s and {{champion:92}} buffs.

You should keep the swearing IMO, it makes your messages feel more "human" instead of feeling like a robot typed the thing or like you're trying extremely hard to not cuss when you really feel like in those messages/posts.

Fuck yeah man

People seem to be saying; because you're professionals, cursing is bad!

Then I look at something like World of Warcraft which is the same age rating throwing around curses in scripts for the game and quests, etc, while freely using it and still being professional, and thoroughly say 'fuck it.'.

The professional part of me says cut back on the swearing, as it makes a person sound more competent when dealing with customers. But the scottish part of me is telling that side of me to go %@#% $@%& #$#*% #$&%& on a friday .__.

In all seriousness though, there is nothing wrong with a little bit of light swearing. Most of us are at the age where we can handle it (Hell, there are plenty of parents that let their kids say words like  damn at 15 or younger) and it does help us feel like you guys at Riot are just like the rest of us, but do remember that as a company, there is a certain amount of professionalism that is expected as well. 
Pretty much if it's something serious, it's best not to be dropping F bombs. But if it's something you want to keep light hearted, some casual cursing can help keep that kind of tone your looking for.
Dude, Music Band is my FAVORITE!!

I have to admit, I'm getting kind of annoyed at that behaviour from Riot. It makes them seem just more unprofessional and as the gif explains perfectly, they aren't pulling off the "connect to gamers" they want.

I am somewhere between. On one hand I always appreciated that say Patch notes are written more casually and interestingly with ease on proffesionality, however seeing a joke like "Nexus Siege games should now be spectate-able via the Buddylist drop down! :) So spectate your friends and trash talk them!" is like wut? Can't decide whether I like it or not.
Casual patch notes are the best.

I don't mind casual so long as it's not crude. I don't want them talking like robots cause that would be overkill and probably annoying as well, but just have it so official stuff in the news section and posts pinned to top of boards don't need any censoring.

Now you just don't get it.

I know it's a joke which is why I don't really mind, I was little shocked like "Wut? Well this was unexpected" at first but it's not like it would cause me 1-hour mental dysfunction because of the stress that one sentence might cast upon me.

Also I am not being sensitive and too pure. I can stand swearing and these kind of jokes when they're on clear satyrical background. I have no problem listening to Tim Minchin wishing a Dingo would rip off his child's head in his Lullaby song as he's satirical performer and singer. We are not talking about sensitivity but "proffesionality". The sentence has naught to do with one's sensitivity, it's just unproffesional. As I said, I can't decide whether I like it or not. On one hand it's rather weird to make jokes like these when their game HAS obvious problems with toxicity, on the other hand I'd rather this less casual approach as community that way feels like part of the development process rather than spectators of what the proffesional elites has settled on (irony I know)

> This generation holy shit.

Generation shaming is quite ridiculous on forums like these as I may be actually and ironically older than you or totally asynchronic with the rest of the individuals from my generation apart of the fact generation is rather vague term.

A tribesman may call you spoiled for you can't hunt your food and facepalm theirself with "This generation holy shit.". A feudal farmer may call you spoiled for you have water installed in your home instead of needing to fetch it from the local well and facepalm theirself with "This generation holy shit.". A victorian child may call you spoiled for you probably played with toys in the age of 9 instead of working in manufactories so that your family has something to eat. And yes, the generation after this "sensitive one" will have another flaw that the generation we shame now will shame the other generation for.

If I wanted to be jerky and assume like you I might say that I understand your lack of interpersonal understanding as your generation couldn't manage to grasp the understanding of selfish biases while my generation has it more trained and is more progressive in this aspect. But I don't mean to assume or generalize.

I'm in my 30's so casual swearing on pinned messages from the game's developers does seem unprofessional to me.  But I'm probably too old to be playing League to begin with lol.

I think it's strange that I can get reported in games for using the same words used by the devs on the forums.  Or, at least people have said they would report language.  Is it reportable then?
It's not actually reportable. The only thing reportable in this situation is being a jerk to another player. It's the intention, not the words used.
Unnecessary swearing on posts that are pinned to the top of the boards is unprofessional, and unnecessary. I like many of the reds that post on the boards, but sometimes Riot tries too hard.
--------Byg Dyck Johnson,2016
